item.title: Using no standard library crates with Webassembly
item.author: rahul.thakoor@gmail.com (Rahul Thakoor)
item.description: When working with Rust + Webassembly, you might want to use some crates in your project. Not all crates work out of the box with Webassembly yet, especially those that rely on System Libraries, File I/O, Networking, etc. With proposals such as WASI or WebAssembly Interface Types, these might work eventually but it isn’t the case yet. The Rust Wasm book suggests: A good rule of thumb is that if a crate supports embedded and #!

item.title: An I2C Rust driver for mma7660fc-based 3-Axis Digital Accelerometer
item.author: rahul.thakoor@gmail.com (Rahul Thakoor)
item.description: This is an I2C implementation for mma7660fc-based 3-Axis Digital Accelerometer. It is an embedded-hal driver as part of the weekly driver initiative by Jorge Aparicio. The Device The MMA7660FC is a Â±1.5 g 3-Axis Accelerometer with Digital Output (I2C). It can be found on Seeed’s Grove 3-Axis Digital Accelerometer. It is made by NXP Semiconductor. Development For the development of this driver, I used the Grove 3-Axis Digital Accelerometer and tested on a Raspberry Pi 1 running latest version of Raspbian.
